quest.name: The Vanishing Act
journal: Alka Zolka is pleasantly surprised to see you.

Alka Zolka has received a missive from Surito Carito, asking that you come see him straightaway. While he has not expounded upon why, it seems extremely urgent. Make your way to upper La Noscea to learn what is amiss at the Wanderer's Palace.

Surito Carito reveals that his study of the invisible voidsent's corpse has yielded a quasi-cure capable of impeding the spread of the Nymian plague. A miraculous discovery though it may be, he goes on to say that the reason he summoned you is because one of his research assistants, Setoto, has vanished. Worried that harm will befall his friend should they wander too far, he asks that you find and escort the tonberry back. Alka believes there is a chance Setoto has been registered to the Hunt, and suggests you begin your search at the Maelstrom Command.

The Hunt billmaster informs you that the only tonberry currently registered to the Hunt is one by the name of Marberry. Not too long after, R'ashaht appears bearing some interesting news. The Miqo'te commander tells you that Vesper Bay has been awash with rumors of an odd-looking stowaway who scurried off a ferry as it pulled ashore. Whoever─or whatever─it was, has been described as being small of stature like a Lalafell but with exotic features. Perhaps this mysterious passenger is your missing tonberry, and it would benefit you to investigate this matter further.

You and Alka approach a sailor who looks to be a crew member of the boat R'ashaht mentioned. The man confirms having seen the stowaway, which he describes as some manner of rare beast of a gobbie without a mask. He assures you that whatever it was, the Brass Blades are looking for it. While Alka makes a detour to Ul'dah to see what more he can uncover though his contacts regarding this incident, he asks that you inform Surito Carito of all that has happened.

Surito Carito is of the opinion that, if in Aldenard, Setoto will be near impossible to find. He believes it would be best to wait until you come across any additional news on where the missing tonberry might have gone before making a move. Rest while you can because as soon as word of Setoto's possible whereabouts reaches you and Alka Zolka, the two of you must rush to find, and possibly rescue, the tonberry.

※The next scholar quest will be available from Surito Carito upon reaching level 63.
objectives: Speak with Surito Carito near the Wanderer's Palace.
Speak with the Maelstrom Command Hunt billmaster.
Rendezvous with Alka Zolka in Vesper Bay.
Report to Surito Carito near the Wanderer's Palace.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Forename, that you should arrive at this very instant─it is as though the gods themselves have sent you.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Not a quarter bell ago I received a missive from Surito Carito. An emergency has arisen at the Wanderer's Palace, and he has requested our immediate presence.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: While the exact nature of this trouble remains unclear, we can scarce ignore his call.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: He awaits us at his usual place. Come, my friend, we haven't a moment to waste!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Alka Zolka, Forename. Thank you both for responding so swiftly to my summons.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Forgive my brusqueness, but I believe it best if we cut straight to business. I presume the both of you remember the invisible voidsent we defeated not too long ago?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: We could scarce forget such a vile creature.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Well, you'll be pleased to hear that I have finished studying its remains and believe a cure may be within my grasp.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Ah, but mayhap “cure” is a slight exaggeration. What I speak of will only halt the spread of the sickness, not reverse all of the effects it has had on our bodies.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Surito Carito, you are far too modest a man! Truly, what you speak of is incredible─a miracle, even.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Alas, it is not to be praised for the progress I've made that I asked you here today. You see, Setoto, one of my comrades who has been assisting me in my experiments, has mysteriously vanished.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: I am terribly worried. While the rancor has subsided from most of our hearts, we still retain our tonberry forms. Were we to wander too far from our home here, any number of organizations would be more than happy to have us hunted down.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: That is why I would ask that you─my two most trusted associates─locate and escort Setoto back to the Wanderer's Palace before it's too late.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Of course we'll do it. We can hardly ignore the pleas of one of Nym's foremost scholars!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Forename, I have an idea of where we can start. Let us check with the Grand Companies to see if a bounty has been placed on Setoto's head.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Bounty? <sigh> Let us hope it has not yet come to that...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: The Maelstrom Command is in Limsa Lominsa. There, we should be able to ask the Hunt billmaster if any tonberries have recently been registered.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: We've done this a million times, and yet something about today has me feeling incredibly restless. Please, let us hurry and see what Surito Carito has to say.

dialogue.name: HUNTBILLMASTER
dialogue.text: Good eveningmorningday to you, sir. How might I be of service to you today?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: We're looking to save─er─slay a tonberry.

dialogue.name: HUNTBILLMASTER
dialogue.text: A tonberry, eh? We currently have only one tonberry marked for the Hunt by the name of Marberry.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Marberry? If I recall correctly, he was marked for the Hunt from even before Setoto disappeared. The possibility of there being a mix-up between the two is slim. It seems we must continue our search elsewhere.

dialogue.name: RASHAHTRHIKI
dialogue.text: [GC Rank] SurnameForename of the Scions, Alka. I wasn't aware the two of you knew each other.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: R'ashaht! Good to see you again. I think I may have forgotten to say so the other day, but I greatly appreciated your help with my training.

dialogue.name: RASHAHTRHIKI
dialogue.text: You know I'm always happy to help. I don't suppose you've come all this way to thank me, however. What brings the two of you here?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: We're searching for an escaped tonberry and thought it might have been marked for the Hunt.

dialogue.name: RASHAHTRHIKI
dialogue.text: A tonberry, you say?

dialogue.name: RASHAHTRHIKI
dialogue.text: While I can't promise this is in any way related, a few days back a disturbance broke out in Vesper Bay. They discovered a stowaway hiding in one of the ferries.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Indeed?

dialogue.name: RASHAHTRHIKI
dialogue.text: Witnesses say that a small green blur leapt from between the crates and dashed out of sight as soon as the ship pulled into port.

dialogue.name: RASHAHTRHIKI
dialogue.text: While of a similar size and build to a Lalafell or Qiqirn, they claim it looked far too alien to be either.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Hm... Thank you, R'ashaht. It sounds like you may have just given us our first lead!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Forename, after me! We make for Vesper Bay with all haste.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: I fear for our friend's safety. Please, Forename, do whatever it takes find and escort Setoto back to the Wanderer's Palace before it's too late.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Oh, good. For a moment I thought I had lost you. Let us begin by questioning this man here─he appears to be one of the men from the ferry R'ashaht told us about.

dialogue.name: DARKSAILOR02923
dialogue.text: Yer askin' if I saw the stowaway? Aye. Ye bet I did.

dialogue.name: DARKSAILOR02923
dialogue.text: Now it wasn't just any stowaway what boarded our ship. Nay. I suspect it was a one o' 'em fellas─a gob─without his mask. Either that, or it's a rare beastie ye can't find around these here parts. Not that it matter, mind ye.

dialogue.name: DARKSAILOR02923
dialogue.text: Whatever it was, the Brass Blades are after it, and ye best be sure they'll catch it.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Indeed. Thank you for all your help, sir.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: If an organization that large has yet to find the stowaway, we've little chance of succeeding in such an endeavor ourselves.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Rather than blindly rushing about, our time would be better spent gathering what information we can regarding this incident. I shall go and speak with my acquaintances in Ul'dah. In the meantime, I ask that you return to Surito Carito and inform him of all that we learned.

dialogue.name: DARKSAILOR02923
dialogue.text: What in the gods' name was that thing? I ain't never seen anythin' like it.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Forename, I can only hope your swift return means you come bearing good news.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: ...Has crossed the sea and is likely now in Thanalan, you say!? What could possibly have spurred our friend to do such a thing?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Surito Carito, forgive my tardiness.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I made a small detour to Ul'dah to speak with my associates. Unfortunately, they could tell me nothing aside from the fact that the Brass Blades are looking into who the stowaway might be. I've, nevertheless, asked that they keep an ear to the ground and report to me should they learn more.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Thank you, Alka Zolka. <sigh> If, as you suspect, our friend has fled to the vast continent of Aldenard, there is little sense in us conducting any more searches.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Judging by the Brass Blades' inability to find their quarry, we should have no need to worry about the Hunt or any other institution capturing Setoto for now. Our best option is to wait until we know more.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I am inclined to agree. Should I come across any new information, I will send word to you right away.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: There's a good chance this search will turn into something of a long-term effort. Forename, I suggest you rest while you still can.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next scholar quest will be available from Surito Carito upon reaching level 63.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.
